entries.title: Why Russia is cheering on the Burkina Faso coup
entries.description: Russian mercenaries look set to profit from the new junta that has seized power in Burkina Faso.

entries.title: US immigration: Why Indians are fleeing halfway around the world
entries.description: Facing danger at home, a record number of Indian migrants have crossed from Mexico into the US.

entries.title: Tommy Jessop: Why I investigated care for patients like me
entries.description: Actor Tommy Jessop and Panorama investigate the avoidable deaths of people with a learning disability.

entries.title: Bahrain: British taxpayers backing security services accused of torture
entries.description: State bodies accused of serious abuses in the Gulf nation have received £1.8m from the UK this year.

entries.title: Creeslough: Who were the 10 victims of petrol station explosion?
entries.description: The 10 people who died in the disaster range in age from five to 59 and lived in or near Creeslough.

entries.title: Harry Kane: England and Tottenham striker to read bedtime story on CBeebies
entries.description: England and Tottenham striker Harry Kane will make his CBeebies Bedtime Stories debut when he reads The Lion Inside by Rachel Bright to the nation's children.

entries.title: Post Office handles more cash as banks close and prices rise
entries.description: Bank closures and rising prices mean more people are turning to the Post Office for cash.

entries.title: Widespread disruption as ScotRail strike goes ahead
entries.description: Passengers face 24 hours of limited services after ScotRail RMT members rejected the latest pay offer.

entries.title: Match of the Day 2: 'Arsenal have a world-beating attack but are playing for second'
entries.description: Match of the Day 2 pundit Danny Murphy says that Arsenal have a world-beating attack with Gabriel Martinelli and Bukayo Saka but will not challenge Man City for the title.

entries.title: Scottish independence: Will there be a second referendum?
entries.description: Nicola Sturgeon wants to hold a second referendum next year, so is another vote now inevitable?

entries.title: The Papers: 'Truss turns on the charm' and 'wrath of Putin'
entries.description: Many of Monday's front pages lead on Liz Truss's plans to unite Tory MPs and a missile strike in Ukraine.

entries.title: Greg Hands named trade minister after Conor Burns sacking
entries.description: The MP had backed Liz Truss's rival for PM but his appointment comes amid calls for party to unite.

entries.title: Iran protests: Germany calls for sanctions over violent crackdown
entries.description: Annalena Baerbock says Germany will ensure the European Union freezes assets and imposes entry bans.

entries.title: Nigeria boat accident kills at least 76 fleeing floodwater
entries.description: President Muhammadu Buhari ordered a review of safety measures in the country's water systems.

entries.title: Fishing nets being recycled to help save the sea
entries.description: Nets used to be brought to shore and left in landfill or discarded in the ocean - putting seals at risk.

entries.title: World Grand Prix: Michael van Gerwen beats Nathan Aspinal to become 2022 World Grand Prix champion
entries.description: Michael van Gerwen holds off a spirited Nathan Aspinall 5-3 to win his sixth World Grand Prix title in Leicester.

entries.title: BBC Young Musician: Percussionist Jordan Ashman wins 2022 contest
entries.description: The 18-year-old from Cambridgeshire is only the third percussionist to win the prestigious contest.

entries.title: Deadly landslides sweep away homes in Venezuela
entries.description: At least 22 people have died and 52 are missing as torrential rain hits the Latin American country.

entries.title: Bafta Cymru: In My Skin takes three awards
entries.description: Dark comedy drama scoops three top awards at the 31st Bafta Cymru ceremony.

entries.title: Creeslough spirit shines amid darkness of tragedy
entries.description: People come together in support of one another at vigils to remember those lost in Friday's blast.

entries.title: Everton 1-2 Man Utd: Cristiano Ronaldo scores 700th club goal as visitors come from behind to win
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo scores his 700th club goal as Manchester United come from behind to beat Everton at Goodison Park in the Premier League.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Manchester United forward scores 700th club goal of career
entries.description: Cristiano Ronaldo reaches another landmark by scoring his 700th club goal to give Manchester United the lead at Everton.

entries.title: Arsenal make most powerful statement so far in Liverpool win
entries.description: Arsenal, showing new guile and steel, make their most powerful statement so far in a win over Liverpool that proves their character.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-2 Liverpool: Mikel Arteta says win is a special moment
entries.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says the 3-2 win over Liverpool was a special moment for his side and their fans as they maintain their place at the top of the Premier League table.

entries.title: Borussia Dortmund 2-2 Bayern Munich: Dortmund score dramatic late equaliser
entries.description: Watch highlights as Borussia Dortmund come from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 with Bayern Munich following Anthony Modeste's dramatic late equaliser at Signal Iduna Park.

entries.title: Crimea bridge: Putin accuses Ukraine of 'terrorism'
entries.description: Vladimir Putin accuses Ukraine of attacking the bridge to Crimea, saying it was an "act of terrorism".

entries.title: NFL London: New York Giants upstage Green Bay Packers & Aaron Rodgers
entries.description: The New York Giants ruin the party for the Green Bay Packers as they fight back to claim a 27-22 win in the second of this year's London Games.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-2 Liverpool: Bukayo Saka double helps Gunners regain top spot
entries.description: Winger Bukayo Saka scores twice as Arsenal beat Liverpool 3-2 at Emirates Stadium to regain top spot in the Premier League.

entries.title: Gianluca Scamacca shows signs of ending West Ham striker curse
entries.description: With three goals in three games across eight days, there are signs that Gianluca Scamacca is the real deal at West Ham United

entries.title: Kilmarnock 2-2 Hearts: Stoppage-time volley completes visitors' comeback
entries.description: Nathaniel Atkinson scores with a stunning volley deep into stoppage time as Hearts hit back from 2-0 down to earn a point with Kilmarnock in a Rugby Park thriller.

entries.title: Trafalgar Square abuzz for Diwali celebrations
entries.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan says Diwali is a reminder of "hope for a brighter tomorrow".

entries.title: West Ham 3-1 Fulham: Gianluca Scamacca continues scoring streak to settle London derby
entries.description: Gianluca Scamacca scores a delightful chip - given after a lengthy VAR review - as West Ham beat Fulham in a London derby on Sunday.

entries.title: England 64-51 Uganda: Roses complete perfect series
entries.description: England defeat Uganda 64-51 at the Copper Box in London to clinch the series against the 'She Cranes' 3-0.

entries.title: Tiger that killed nine people in India shot dead
entries.description: Elephants are used in the operation to hunt down the man-eater in Bihar state.

entries.title: Crystal Palace 2-1 Leeds United: Eberechi Eze seals comeback win
entries.description: Eberechi Eze scores a fine goal as Crystal Palace come from behind to beat Leeds at Selhurst Park and end their winless run in the Premier League.

entries.title: Iker Casillas: Ex-Real Madrid and Spain keeper deletes 'I'm gay' tweet and says he was hacked
entries.description: Ex-Real Madrid and Spain goalkeeper Iker Casillas deletes a Tweet that announced he was gay - saying his account was hacked.

entries.title: SNP conference: A calm event amid stormy times
entries.description: Does the SNP conference feel like a gathering one year away from an independence referendum?

entries.title: Crimean bridge: Who - or what - caused the explosion?
entries.description: Russia has blamed a truck bomb - but examination of the footage seems to contradict that.

entries.title: Sturgeon accused of divisive rhetoric for saying 'I detest Tories'
entries.description: Nicola Sturgeon is accused of "dangerous" rhetoric by Nadhim Zahawi but SNP politicians defend her.

entries.title: Japanese Grand Prix: Max Verstappen's class the only certainty on 'confusing & weird' day for F1
entries.description: Max Verstappen's second world title was just reward for a mature and controlled season, but came on a "weird" and "confusing" day for F1, writes Andrew Benson.

entries.title: Jos Buttler on deciding against 'risky' appeal for obstruction against Matthew Wade
entries.description: England captain Jos Buttler explains why he decided not to appeal for obstructing the field against Matthew Wade.

entries.title: Protests in Iran: Two members of security forces killed
entries.description: Two members of Iran's security forces are killed in protests sparked by the death of a young woman.

entries.title: Galar Gdański: Three killed in Poland as wave capsizes tourist boat
entries.description: Officials think a wave from a nearby tug boat turned over the barge in a river in Gdansk.

entries.title: Centaurus Mall fire: Large blaze erupts at Islamabad shopping mall
entries.description: A blaze breaks out at the Centaurus Mall in the Pakistani capital but no casualties are reported.

entries.title: Oswestry: Murder arrest after woman dies in hit-and-run
entries.description: A 22-year-old woman has died after being hit by a car outside a takeaway, police said.

entries.title: England in Australia: Alex Hales & Mark Wood star in first T20
entries.description: Alex Hales whacks 84 off 51 balls as he spearheads England's eight-run victory over Australia in the first T20 in Perth.

entries.title: Creeslough: Victims of explosion named by police
entries.description: Ten people including two teenagers and a five-year-old are among those killed.

entries.title: Energy use advice campaign pulled due to cost, Zahawi says
entries.description: The cabinet minister tells the BBC the public information campaign would have cost up to £15m.

entries.title: Anger as truck triggers memories of Bianchi F1 death
entries.description: Formula 1 drivers and team principals condemn race officials for putting a recovery vehicle on track in wet conditions at the Japanese Grand Prix.

entries.title: Euro 2024 qualifying: England drawn with Italy; Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland discover groups
entries.description: England are drawn in the same group as Italy - the team that beat them in the Euro 2020 final - in qualifying for Euro 2024 in Germany.

entries.title: Former footballer killed in Glasgow roundabout crash
entries.description: Gavin Stokes' family called him 'the life and soul of the party' and said his son was his whole world.

entries.title: Rugby Football League: Former players to sue RFL over brain damage
entries.description: Seventy-five former players are set to launch a legal claim against the Rugby Football League for negligence this week, their lawyers say.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: Wales 18-15 Scotland highlights - late penalty seals thriller
entries.description: Watch highlights as Wales beat Scotland 18-15 after Keira Bevan converts a last-minute penalty following a thrilling match.

entries.title: Gambia cough syrup scandal: Police investigate deaths linked to medicine
entries.description: Senior officials are called for questioning after 66 children died with acute kidney injuries.

entries.title: Nicola Sturgeon 'will never give up' on independence
entries.description: The first minister tells Laura Kuenssberg she is confident a Scottish referendum can happen in 2023.

entries.title: Nicola Sturgeon: I detest the Tories...but will try to work with Truss
entries.description: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon speaks to the BBC's Laura Kuenssberg about working with the new PM.

entries.title: Zaporizhzhia attack: Russian shelling in 'annexed' city kills 17
entries.description: The city is controlled by Ukrainian forces, but is in a region illegally annexed by Russia.

entries.title: Verstappen seals title after Japanese Grand Prix win
entries.description: Max Verstappen clinches a second title in extraordinary circumstances after dominating a Japanese Grand Prix truncated by heavy rain.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: Wales 18-15 Scotland - late Keira Bevan penalty wins it
entries.description: Keira Bevan kicks an 84th-minute penalty to clinch a thrilling 18-15 win against Scotland in their World Cup opener.

entries.title: Boxer David Pearce: Forgotten images of 'Newport's Rocky' revealed
entries.description: After spending almost 40 years forgotten in a box, photos of "Newport's Rocky" go on display.

entries.title: Creeslough: Tributes to Donegal petrol station explosion victims
entries.description: Support will be available for those affected by Friday's tragedy, says the Irish government.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Fans with banning orders will be stopped from going to tournament
entries.description: More than 1,300 fans with football banning orders in England and Wales will be stopped from travelling to the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: Lessons from England’s record 14-try win against Fiji
entries.description: A maul that might be getting boring and tackles that need tightening - what we learned about England.

entries.title: Luvo Manyonga: World champion & Olympic silver medallist's drug fight
entries.description: Luvo Manyonga was athletics' feel-good story. But his journey from drug addict to world champion has not yet reached a happy ending.

entries.title: Crimea bridge: Russia ramps up security after blast
entries.description: Moscow moves to secure the key connector and repair it as soon as possible after the explosion.

entries.title: Cabinet ministers urge Tory MPs to unite behind Liz Truss
entries.description: Senior MPs call on the party to rally around Liz Truss or risk ending up in opposition.

entries.title: HMS Montrose: Royal Navy seizes drugs worth £15m in Arabian Sea
entries.description: Hundreds of kilograms of crystal methamphetamine were recovered from a small boat.
